conclusion: State A: p = 3 × 10⁵ Pa, V = 1 × 10⁻³ m³, T = 27 °C = 300 K
State B: p = 1 × 10⁵ Pa, V = 1 × 10⁻³ m³
State C: p = 1 × 10⁵ Pa, V = 3 × 10⁻³ m³
Determine nR using pV = nRT for state A: nR = 1 J K⁻¹
Find temperature of state B: T_B = 100 K
Find temperature of state C: T_C = 300 K
Change in internal energy ΔU = 0 because T_C = T_A
Work done from A to B (isochoric): W_AB = 0
Work done from B to C (isobaric): W_BC = 200 J
Total work done by the gas: W = 200 J
Heat transferred Q = ΔU + W = 200 J
Final answer: The gas absorbs 200 J of heat during the A → B → C process
